summary: This is an internal FBI email chain discussing a draft operational plan (OPLAN) for the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell. The email requests review and forwarding to ASAC Creasey for final approval, indicating final preparations for her arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the draft operational plan (OPLAN) for arrest. She is the central figure of the email's purpose.

persons.name: Creasey
persons.context: The individual to whom the approved OPLAN needs to be forwarded for final approval, indicating a supervisory role in the arrest operation.

connections.description: Creasey, as ASAC, is in a position to give final approval for the operational plan to arrest Maxwell.

events.title: Drafting of Maxwell Arrest OPLAN
events.description: Internal FBI correspondence circulates a draft operational plan for the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell for review and final approval.

keyFacts: The FBI was finalizing an operational plan (OPLAN) for the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell on June 30, 2020.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination, with the draft plan requiring review and final approval from ASAC Creasey.
The document indicates the high-priority nature of the operation, marked with 'Importance: High'.
